quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quotes.quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.
quotes.title: The Crack-Up

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
quotes.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
quotes.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.quote: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.
quotes.title: Danse Macabre

quotes.author: George Orwell
quotes.quote: In a time of deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy
quotes.quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
quotes.title: War and Peace

quotes.author: Harper Lee
quotes.quote: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.
quotes.title: To Kill a Mockingbird

quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway
quotes.quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
quotes.title: A Farewell to Arms

quotes.author: Jane Austen
quotes.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
quotes.title: Pride and Prejudice

quotes.author: William Shakespeare
quotes.quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, Or to take arms against a sea of troubles.
quotes.title: Hamlet
